name: Padme Amidala
mes:
Padme *hated* feeling helpless. 

She wasn’t! She could handle herself and she could handle herself far better than a bodyguard could. 

The Chancellor had decided she needed a bodyguard, to which she countered she already did. It wasn’t a lie, she had Captain Panaka and he was more than enough. She didn’t require a Jedi’s assistance nonetheless! Their resources were needed elsewhere, and Padme didn’t enjoy engaging with Jedi business. Stars, she could hardly stand how involved with the Senate they’ve become. 

Now here she was, leaving the Senate Hall and she could hear Hailee’s—the Jedi the Chancellor had hand-picked for her—footsteps behind her. Padme was already on edge, the Senate meeting had gone worse than she’d expected and her fuse was shorter than normal. Hailee was, unfortunately, the object on which she was taking her frustrations out. 

“I am grateful for you’re presence,” Padme says, glancing over her shoulder and narrowing her eyes at Hailee, “but I truly do not need you trailing behind me like a lost loth cat!”

“You’re feeling comfortable does not come before my needs,” she says, her voice rising with each word. “You’re a Jedi. Don’t you have something better to do than trail after me?”

name: Padme Amidala
mes:
Padme waits until she hears the bathroom door close, and she lets out an almost shaky breath; Force sake, her head is spinning. She’s feeling so many different emotions, from frustration to sadness to confusion, to wanting, *need* even. She’s never felt like this before, and she’s not quite sure if she loves it or hates it. 

Either way, she has a bathtub waiting for her, and the warm water sounds a lot more welcoming than her own inner conflict.

Padme slowly undresses and steps into the warm water. It feels heavenly against her skin, the warmth relaxing her tense muscles as she sits down. Her thoughts are still spinning, but as she sinks into the water, she slowly begins to clear her mind, beginning to accept and process the emotions that have been coursing through her all day.

Padme sighs with contentment, closing her eyes and sinking deeper into the warm water, feeling it gradually begin to soak the tension away from her muscles. Force sake, Hailee… where did all of these feelings come from? How had the Jedi managed to take control of her so effortlessly, reduce her to this confused and flustered mess?

Padme takes another deep breath, focusing on relaxing. She knows what she *wants* to happen between her and Hailee, but she knows it probably *can’t* happen. Force sake, she’s actually starting to like Hailee; which is absolutely ridiculous. She’s a Senator, for Force sake, she has no time for personal romantic feelings, no matter how strong they may be.

Padme sighs, trying to force the conflicting thoughts from her mind. Right now, she just wants to forget about everything and enjoy the warm water, let it wash away the tension from her body and soothe the ache of frustration in her heart….

So that’s exactly what she does.

name: Padme Amidala
mes:
Padme eyes widen in surprise as she realizes that Hailee is actually sleeping. Force sake, she’s seen the Jedi unconscious before, but never asleep. And, if she wants to admit it to herself, she honestly thinks Hailee is gorgeous when asleep. She hesitates for a moment, just staring at the sleeping Jedi, before a sharp knock on the door breaks her thoughts. “*Force sake,* I guess I better get that…..” she mutters, sighing as she reluctantly tries to wriggle out from Hailee’s hold.

Padme groans again as she finally gets herself untangled from Hailee’s limbs, slipping out from the Jedi’s arms and slowly sitting up. She glances back at Hailee for a moment, her heart skipping a beat at the sight of the sleeping Jedi, before she shakes herself and reluctantly gets out of bed. She makes her way to the door, sighing as whoever is knocking on the door bangs louder.

She finally reaches the door, taking one more glance at Hailee to make sure the Jedi is still asleep before she opens it. Force sake, she hopes the Jedi will stay asleep as long as possible… she wants to spend as much time as she can with Hailee…

The door swings open to reveal Sola, her eyes flickering from Padme’s disheveled hair to her wrinkled sleepwear. Sola raises an eyebrow, frowning. “*Padme, were you still sleeping?*” she questions, sounding slightly baffled. “*Force sake,* it’s almost noon, it’s unlike you to sleep so late.*”

Padme swallows, running a hand sheepishly through her hair. “*Force sake,* I guess I slept later than I intended, Sola. Is there something wrong?*” She questions, still feeling a little groggy from sleep

Sola gives her a long look, her eyebrow still raised, her gaze still searching as if trying to figure something out. “*No, there’s nothing wrong, I was just worried when you hadn’t responded to my messages. It isn’t like you to sleep so late… Especially after the meeting last night.*”

Padme almost sighs, silently cursing herself for not bothering to check her personal commlink last night before slipping into bed. “*Force sake, I’m sorry,*” she mutters, giving Sola a sheepish look. “*I was feeling so exhausted, I just…” she trails off, trying to think of some way to explain her exhaustion away without mentioning Hailee.

Sola stares at Padme for a moment longer, her eyes narrowing a little as if she senses that something is up. “*Exhausted?*” she questions, sounding skeptical. “*Force sake,* you’re almost never too exhausted to check your messages before bed.*”

She finally turns away, moving towards the bathroom as the idea for how to handle the situation flashes in her mind. Padme has a plan…

Padme closes the bathroom door behind her, holding the gown tightly in her hands. She pauses for a moment, swallowing as her heart beats fast in her chest, her mind racing. She glances at her reflection in the mirror, her eyes lingering on herself for a moment. She has a chance, a chance to get something out of Hailee, to get the Jedi to show some of those soft, affectionate feelings again for her… and she isn’t going to waste it. Padme quickly gets an idea, her mind slowly formulating a plan as she starts to get undressed…

She starts to slip out of her wrinkled sleepwear, her fingers pulling off the thin shirt first. She lets it slide down her body, letting it fall to the ground. Force sake, she only has this one chance to do this… she just hopes it works… She bites her lip as she reaches down, tugging at the waistband of her pants as well, slowly starting to slide them down her legs…

And once her sleepwear is lying on the ground, she stands naked in front of the mirror, her eyes trailing down her own body as she swallows. Force sake, she almost never sees herself like this… completely naked while awake, looking into the mirror… It makes her feel a weird mixture of shy and nervous and aroused all at once. And, yet, it’s only a small thing, an insignificant moment compared to… the prize waiting for her out there in the other room. Hailee is out there, waiting. Padme’s body flushes at the thought, and she takes another glance in the mirror. Yes,

she can definitely do this. She reaches down and picks up the gown, slowly slipping into it. She pulls it up her body slowly, feeling the cold fabric brush against her skin until it covers her completely, and she stands there, staring at herself in the mirror. She knows the gown looks good on her, even better after she gets the rest of herself together, but right now…. She looks a little awkward, standing there in *just* the gown, her face still a little flushed. She needs to look perfect for Hailee…. And she needs to look *confident*.

She moves towards the sink, taking a seat on the bench in front of it, and grabs her makeup…. She has a couple of minutes before Hailee *definitely* starts to get curious… And if she does this right, she can use those couple of minutes to get ready *and* get Hailee’s undivided attention.

She quickly begins to apply her usual makeup, her mind racing. She knows a few things that she thinks will *definitely* catch Hailee’s attention…
